# Post‑operative Surveillance Imaging Plan – Patient 12345

**Diagnosis:** WHO Grade II Astrocytoma (C71.9)  
**Resection:** Gross‑total  
**Surgery Date:** 2024‑09‑15  

## Imaging Schedule
| Timepoint | Modality | Reason |
|-----------|----------|--------|
| 3 months post‑op | MRI with gadolinium contrast | Baseline post‑resection assessment |
| 6 months post‑op | MRI with gadolinium contrast | Early detection of recurrence |
| 12 months post‑op | MRI with gadolinium contrast | Standard surveillance |
| 18 months post‑op | MRI with gadolinium contrast | Continued monitoring |
| 24 months post‑op | MRI with gadolinium contrast | Continued monitoring |
| Annually thereafter (Month 36 onward) | MRI with gadolinium contrast | Long‑term surveillance |

**Notes**
- Continue clinical evaluation at each imaging visit.
- Shorten interval or add advanced imaging if new neurological symptoms arise or if pathology upgrades.

**Follow‑up Appointment**
- Schedule next neuro‑oncology visit for 2025‑03‑01 (≈ 6 months post‑op) to review imaging and discuss adjuvant therapy options.
